title: fmt.Printf() etc support "%%" for "%" but docs don't say so
body:
This program outputs the expected output:

package main
import "fmt"
func main() {
    fmt.Printf("I'm with you %d%%!\n", 100)
}

I'm with you 100%!


One solution is to simply update the docs, e.g.

"Since % is used to specify format verbs if a literal percent sign is needed use
%%."
